A priest of the UOC is being tried in the Cherkasy region for justifying the war

On May 30, in the city of Smila, Cherkasy region, a trial began against the rector of the Church of the Intercession of the Mother of God in the village of Melnikivka, who is accused of justifying Russian aggression against Ukraine.

The reason for the accusation was the personal correspondence found on his phone, in which, according to the prosecutor, there are statements in support of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation. Among the quoted messages:

"The Russian soldier liberated the world from fascism, Nazism and other filth. I am immensely grateful to God that I am a Russian."

The priest is charged under Part 2 of Article 436-2 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine - up to 8 years in prison. He partially admitted his guilt. The court ordered him to be under round-the-clock house arrest until July 29. The next hearing is scheduled for June 23.

üì∑: Suspilne Cherkasy
